name: infat
description: Tool to set default openers for file formats and url schemes on macOS

repo.name: infat
repo.description: A command line tool to set default openers for file formats and url schemes on macos

readme.summary: Excellent documentation with clear examples and installation instructions, but lacks dedicated troubleshooting section despite mentioning verbose logging.
readme.top_issue: No troubleshooting section addressing common errors, permission issues, or failure modes despite the tool modifying system-level file associations

injection_risks.description: The `config::Config::from_file` function may be vulnerable to path traversal attacks if the configuration file path is not properly sanitized.

The `association::get_info_for_extension`, `association::get_info_for_url_scheme`, and `association::get_info_for_type` functions may be vulnerable to injection attacks if the input parameters are not properly sanitized.

critical_findings: Potential path traversal vulnerability in the `config::Config::from_file` function.
Potential injection attacks in the `association::get_info_for_extension`, `association::get_info_for_url_scheme`, and `association::get_info_for_type` functions.
security.summary: The code has some security concerns, including potential path traversal and injection vulnerabilities, but overall it appears to be well-structured and follows good security practices.

common_complaints: Configuration not being applied correctly (xcode still used despite config)
File generation causing unnecessary diffs (infat.toml sorting)
macOS system state issues requiring unclear debugging steps
Crashes and stability issues in recent versions
sentiment.summary: Active community engagement with a mix of configuration bugs and feature requests; maintainer is responsive to issues but several core functionality problems remain unresolved, suggesting moderate ongoing maintenance rather than active development.

communication.summary: The maintainer responses are generally clear and helpful, showing patience with users and a willingness to explain technical details.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being recent (Jan 2, 2026)
Zero active contributors in past 6 months
No merged PRs in past 6 months indicating no maintenance activity
No closed issues in past 6 months suggesting issues are not being addressed
3 open issues with no resolution activity
maintenance.summary: Package shows signs of abandonment with no maintenance activity, contributor engagement, or issue resolution in the past 6 months.

changelog.summary: The changelog is well-organized and comprehensive, but lacks migration guides for users upgrading from previous versions.

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The documentation is well-structured and provides a good overview of the package's functionality, but some sections could be improved for better clarity and conciseness.
concerns: Docs: Lack of explicit troubleshooting section with common problems and solutions
Security: Potential path traversal vulnerability in the `config::Config::from_file` function.
Security: Potential injection attacks in the `association::get_info_for_extension`, `association::get_info_for_url_scheme`, and `association::get_info_for_type` functions.
High bus factor risk (97% from top contributor)
highlights: Recent commits in the past six months
Merged PRs in the recent period
Contributors active in the recent period
Breaking changes clearly marked in changelog
